name: BrewPi Remix
description: The BrewPi Remix branch is an updated version of the original Arduino firmware that is actively maintained by Lee Bussy.  This variant is the "RevC" firmware - which supports LCD screens connected through a parallel interface. If your LCD screen is connected via 4 pins, you need to use the I2C variant.

name: BrewPi-ESP8266

variant_description: Connects to the Raspberry Pi via serial (requires a USB cable between the Pi and the ESP8266 to run).

name: TiltBridge
description:
TiltBridge is a hardware Tilt-to-WiFi bridge using the ESP32. Take the Bluetooth signal coming from your Tilt, and push it to the cloud.

Although Fermentrack supports using the Bluetooth radio on most modern Raspberry Pis to receive and record gravity readings coming from your Tilt, if your Raspberry Pi is nowhere near your fermenter sometimes it can use some help receiving the signal. TiltBridge provides you a means by which to receive & retransmit the signal to anywhere on your network - or anywhere in the world.

This version includes support for pushing Tilt data to Fermentrack, Google Sheets, Brewers Friend, Brewfather, Brewstatus, MQTT, Grainfather, and Taplistio.
variant_description: This variant is for models with 16MB of flash space and TFT screens (e.g. D32 Pro with TFT). This firmware is not appropriate for OLED or "TTGO USB-C" models.

name: TiltBridge

variant_description: This variant is specifically intended to be used with the "TTGO USB-C" style boards with ST7789-driven TFT screens.

name: BrewPi Remix Uno Wiring Test
description:
This firmware will allow you to test the setup of your BrewPi family Arduino Uno. The program will:

1. Turn the onboard LED on
2. Scan for an I2C device. If found, it will use A0 for sensor tests; otherwise, it will use the original A4 pin for sensors. If the program detects an I2C LCD, a test message will display
3. Check the OneWire
4. Display if parasitic OneWire sensors are present on the bus
5. Display the number and type of sensors found
6. Display the address and current temperature for each sensor
7. Test the heat and cool relays (pins 5 and 6)
8. Clear the EEPROM to avoid issues saving the sensors later on

name: WiFi Reset & Sensor/Wiring Test
description: This firmware conducts a handful of tests on your DS18B20 sensors and either your I2C or TFT screen (depending on which is connected) to ensure the sensors will properly support BrewPi installs and that your LCD is wired up properly. This also will reset any errant WiFi configuration that may be causing issues connecting to your network.

name: WiFi Reset & Sensor/Wiring Test
description: This firmware conducts a handful of tests on your DS18B20 sensors and I2C LCD screen to ensure the sensors will properly support BrewPi installs and that your LCD is wired up properly. This also will reset any errant WiFi configuration that may be causing issues connecting to your network.

name: BrewPiLess
description: BrewPiLess is an attempt to implement the same features/functionality available in BrewPi entirely on the ESP8266 and in the cloud. In addition to the features originally available in BrewPi, it adds additional new functionality like iSpindel support.
variant_description: The "Thorrak" (or thorrax) variant uses the same pinout as the BrewPi-ESP8266 firmware. This is the "4m1m" variant

name: WiFi Reset & Sensor/Wiring Test
description: This firmware conducts a handful of tests on your DS18B20 sensors & I2C LCD to ensure the sensors will properly support BrewPi installs (and that your LCD is wired up properly). This also will reset any errant WiFi configuration that may be causing issues connecting to your network.

name: BrewPi-ESP8266 (DO NOT USE)
description:
BrewPi Firmware for the ESP8266.

This firmware is a beta version under development and should not be used by most users. Critically, this version does not have the complete compressor protection delay found in the regular firmware, and may damage or destroy compressor-based cooling systems. 

Seriously - Unless you were told to download this, avoid it.
variant_description: This firmware connects to the Raspberry Pi via WiFi. This has significantly lower delays for compressor protection as compared to the regular BrewPi firmware.

name: TiltBridge - BETA - D32_Pro_TFT
description:
TiltBridge is a hardware Tilt-to-WiFi bridge using the ESP32. Take the Bluetooth signal coming from your Tilt, and push it to the cloud.

Although Fermentrack supports using the Bluetooth radio on most modern Raspberry Pis to receive and record gravity readings coming from your Tilt, if your Raspberry Pi is nowhere near your fermenter sometimes it can use some help receiving the signal. TiltBridge provides you a means by which to receive & retransmit the signal to anywhere on your network - or anywhere in the world.

This version is an alpha version testing some changes to the firmware, and generally should be avoided unless you have been told to use it.
variant_description: This variant is for models with 16MB of flash space and TFT screens (e.g. D32 Pro with TFT). This firmware is not appropriate for OLED or "TTGO USB-C" models.
